title: What will be the answer if a>0 and b>0 than a-b>0? - Quora

response.answer_text: In simple terms, if a>0 and b>0, then definitely for every math a-b>0, provided there are some conditions to look after, a-b>0 only if a is not equal to ba>bPut in words, Difference between two positive numbers is always a positive number provided the two numbers are not same and the number being subtracted by is always greater than the other number.

In the above the following must prevail : a > b, and a and b can be any number, integer, rational or irrational number above zero, where a must be greater than b at all times for the above mathematical statement. KT
